alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON AND SOUTH CENTRAL CENTRE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntingdon, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Grove Mills, Ramblewood, Franklinville, Whipple Dam State Park, Mcalevys Fort, Rock Springs and Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
